name: Xi'an Jiangcun Ditch Garbage Landfill Site
about: This site was designed to receive about 2,500 tons of waste every day, but instead ended up taking 10,000 tons of waste daily. As a result, it filled quickly and was forced to close 25 years earlier than intended.

name: Apex Regional Landfill
about: This site is the largest landfill in the United States and receives approximately 9,000 tons of solid waste every day, although it can manage up to 15,000 tons. It opened in 1993 and should be operational for 250 years.

name: Bordo Poniente
about: This landfill was the largest landfill in Latin America, up until its closure at the end of 2011. It received between 12,000 and 15,000 tons of waste daily. When the landfill was closed, the 1,500+ families who made a living from collecting recycleables for reselling lost their source of income.

name: Laogang Landfill
about: This landfill is one of the largest landfills in Asia and handles round 10,000 tons of waste every day, which is estimated to be about half of the waste generated by Shanghai.

name: Malagrotta Landfill
about: This site is one of the largest landfills in Europe and accepts between 4,500 and 5,000 tons of waste daily. However, Malagrotta Landfill has been extremely detrimental to the air, water, soil, and general environment of the local areas.

name: Puente Hills Landfill
about: At the height of its operation, this landfill received up to 13,200 tons of trash daily. It was closed in October of 2013 and is currently being converted into a park.

name: Sudokwon Landfill
about: This landfill receives between 18,000 and 20,000 tons of waste every day from Seoul. There is also an on-site water recycling plant, as well as a museam and other examples of sustainable waste management.

name: Delhi Landfills
about: The Delhi Landfills consists of four different landfills: Narela Bawana, Bhalswa, Okhla, and Ghazipur. Together, they receive the 9,200+ tons of waste that New Delhi produces every day. However, of the four landfills, only Narela Bawana – the newest landfill – still has room to receive more waste.

name: Deonar Landfill
about: This landfill is one of the oldest in India and receives 5,500 ons of waste daily.

name: West New Territories Landfill
about: This landfill is one of three that serves Hong Kong. It receives over 7,200 tons of waste every day.

name: Xinfeng Landfill
about: This site takes 7,000 tons of the average 8,000 tons of waste generated by Guangzhou every day.
